channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'A never Trump guy': A Vance remix goes viral
Beep... beep: Trump rants on Fox, punches phone buttons
Taliban ban women's voices & faces sans veils in public
item.description: The Taliban in Afghanistan issued new laws approved by supreme leader Hibatullah Akhundzada, enforcing restrictions on women's public presence. Women must veil fully in public, avoid any bare faces, and their voices should not be heard publicly. The laws, published on Wednesday, also ban music and non-related men and women mixing in public settings.

item.title: Rohingyas in dire condition in Bangladesh camps, says HRW
‘War will end with Ukraine remaining a ...’: Biden affirms support to Ukraine, approves new military package
item.description: President Joe Biden announced a $125 million military aid package for Ukraine, reaffirming US support amid its ongoing conflict with Russia. He discussed the significance of this support with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. The package includes air-defense missiles and other critical weapons. The US also imposed sanctions on over 400 Russian entities and individuals aiding the war effort.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘Want to thank Bobby’: Trump expresses gratitude to ‘great guy’ RFK Jr for his endorsement
item.description: Former President Donald Trump thanked Robert F Kennedy Jr for endorsing him during a restaurant visit in Las Vegas. Kennedy, who had run as a third-party presidential candidate, announced the suspension of his campaign and criticised the Democratic Party for their actions against him and Trump. He cited diminishing poll numbers and financial issues as reasons for his withdrawal.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Several dead, many injured after knife attack at a festival in Germany
item.description: A knife attack during a festival in Solingen, Germany, on Friday evening left three dead and at least five seriously injured. The unidentified attacker fled the scene quickly and remains at large. The incident casts a shadow over Solingen's 650th anniversary celebrations, leading to the festival's cancellation and leaving the community in shock and grief.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Iranian hackers group targeted WhatsApp accounts of Biden, Trump officials: Meta
item.description: Meta reported detecting a hacking campaign targeting WhatsApp accounts of US officials from both the Biden and Trump administrations. The attacks, attributed to Iranian hacker group APT42, involved masquerading as technical support for online services like Google and AOL. Meta blocked the attempts and found no evidence of successful breaches.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Biden talks with Zelenskyy, announces new military aid for Kyiv
Historic 'League of their own' ballpark burns down in California
item.description: A fire engulfed the historic wooden grandstands at Jay Littleton Ball Park in Ontario, Southern California. Built in 1937, the grandstands were a notable filming location, featured in movies like 'A League of Their Own.' While no injuries were reported, the cause is still under investigation, with aged dry wood possibly intensifying the blaze.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kerry Kennedy calls RFK Jr's endorsement of Trump a 'betrayal' of family values
item.description: Kerry Kennedy expressed disappointment as her brother, RFK Jr, withdrew from the presidential race to endorse Donald Trump. She endorsed Kamala Harris and Tim Walz, noting a breach of family values in her brother’s decision. RFK Jr cited no viable path to victory as the reason for his withdrawal.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Arizona man Ronald Lee Syvrud arrested for issuing death threats against Donald Trump
item.description: Ronald Lee Syvrud was arrested by Arizona authorities after posting death threats against former President Donald Trump, who was attending a campaign event in the state. The 66-year-old was apprehended without resistance in Cochise County. This incident followed a recent assassination attempt on Trump during a campaign rally in Pennsylvania.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Broken seats, overhead bin held together with duct tape': Passenger recounts harrowing experience on PIA flight
item.description: A PIA passenger recounted his treacherous flight to Skardu, describing the journey as fraught with unexpected challenges due to the airline's troubled state. He faced issues such as a broken seat handle and overhead bin held together with duct tape, all while flying through dangerous mountain ranges. Despite his concerns, he was captivated by Skardu's stunning scenery.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Harry and Meghan’s pact: Why children Archie and Lilibet won’t star in upcoming Netflix shows
item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle had differing views on their children's public exposure, with Meghan initially agreeing to feature them in a Netflix show. However, Harry's preference to shield their children has prevailed, and Archie and Lilibet will be out of the limelight. Meghan also chose a different filming location for her cooking show to protect her family's privacy.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump assassination attempt: Multiple Secret service agents placed on leave amid ongoing probe
item.description: Following an assassination attempt on Donald Trump, the Secret Service put at least five agents on leave, including the head of the Pittsburgh field office. The shooter, Thomas Matthew Crooks, managed to fire multiple shots, causing casualties and injuring Trump. The incident led to the resignation of Secret Service Director Kimberly Cheatle soon after.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Like Steak or Spaghetti': Trump's old interview on homosexuality goes viral
item.description: An old interview with Donald Trump from Late Night with Conan O'Brien has resurfaced online. In the 2004 interview, Trump asked a contestant about his sexuality and later compared choosing a partner to selecting a meal from a menu. The comment has sparked debates on social media, especially given Trump's complex stance on LGBTQ rights.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'What real love looks like': Michelle Obama lauds Gus Walz’s emotional DNC reaction, slams online bullies
item.description: Michelle Obama praised Gus Walz, son of vice president candidate Tim Walz, for his heartfelt reaction at the Democratic National Convention. Obama denounced the bullying Gus faced after Ann Coulter called him 'weird.' Gus, diagnosed with nonverbal learning disorder and anxiety, stood out for his emotional pride when his dad took the stage.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Ann Coulter, Conservative commentator who sparked political storm after 'weird' comment on Gus Walz
item.description: Ann Coulter sparked controversy with a now-deleted tweet calling Minnesota governor Tim Walz's son 'weird' after he emotionally supported his father at the Democratic National Convention. The backlash was swift, prompting Coulter to remove the post, citing his autism diagnosis. Coulter is known for her bold, often controversial conservative commentary and books supporting Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Asserting her patriotic credentials, Kamala paints Trump as un-American
item.description: "Just imagine Donald Trump with no guardrails, and how he would use the immense powers of the presidency of the United States. Not to improve your life, not to strengthen our national security, but to serve the only client he has ever had: himself," she warned while presenting her self as a prosecutor who has only had one client her entire career: the people.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: Type 2 Polio virus paralyses baby in Gaza, UN calls for immediate vaccination campaign
item.description: A 10-month-old baby in Gaza was paralysed by type 2 polio, the first occurrence in 25 years, reported the World Health Organisation (WHO). The case has prompted urgent calls for a vaccination campaign amidst Gaza's war-damaged health infrastructure. Israel and Hamas have agreed to support vaccination efforts to mitigate the outbreak among the vulnerable population.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
